TopicTitle: Anything You Can Walk Away From

Articles.Content:
I just did a small Mun run trying to land at points by myself (after being taught by MechJeb). So I got to the Mun and landed there (after a few hiccups and redos because I wasn't happy with the landing accuracy) and then I returned to KSP... and nearly messed it all up.

First off I forgot to do a quicksave so it was a definite booboo. I remembered when I was in atmosphere and of course you can't save while you are in atmo. So it was slightly worrying. To make matters worse I was coming in with a ship with no lights and a night time landing. And I misjudged the ground. So I hit a bit hard. AND KERBOOOOOOOOOMMM... Loads of explosions. But My Kerbs survived somehow.

When the sun came up I saw this.... and went "WOW!... lucky Kerbonauts there!". EVERY engine had exploded and I had lost two of my landing legs. But the parachutes had slowed it enough that it survived.

This was me doing a fast re-entry to KSP...

Edited May 19, 2013 by NeoMorph
Any landing you can walk away from wasn't fast enough - jebadiah Kerman

Nice. I think those trusses saved the ship.

This was me attempting to land a spaceplane earlier. Stalled at the last second, less than 500m above the ground. I removed those short wings for the next test; all they did in the end was make the plane want to stall the whole way through re-entry.
Don't worry about it, I frequently have unplanned catastrophic dis-assemblies of my rocket that my kerbals can walk away from, they are considered successful failures.

The worst part of this Duna mission, I had plenty of fuel so this should NOT have happened. Oh well...

Album
Good thing it was only the landing legs and not the engine. And huzzah for spare landing legs!
I honestly have no idea what I did to land this thing upside-down in the middle of the ocean.

I just bought KSP on Steam yesterday. Now hours later I am wondering, "where did the weekend go?"

I'm an old veteran of Orbiter, so the basics came quickly. After some trial and error, I got a custom lander up to the Mun.

Can't figure out how to attach, but my little lander turned over. Guess I have to build a rescue mission now!

And we have landed!!

Well, sort of. But we can duct tape it back together right?

Nope;.;

LOL... some classic pictures there. I love how awesome Mild Peril's ship looks from underneath... and then you see that engine off in the distance heh. Kind of a "WHOA... DOH!"

Hey, that can be the term for a what looks awesome initally but then you realise is a bit of a spherical object up.

"Hey Bob, I just did a WHOADOH!" - Jeb.

Oh and 537... yes, you did an excellent WHOADOH there!
I've posted this before, but here's Jeb pinned down under some debris after a powered landing quickly became unpowered due to lack of fuel...
Yay... Nurph invented the VTOC... Vertical Takeoff and Crashing

I just bought KSP on Steam yesterday. Now hours later I am wondering, "where did the weekend go?"

I'm an old veteran of Orbiter, so the basics came quickly. After some trial and error, I got a custom lander up to the Mun.

Can't figure out how to attach, but my little lander turned over. Guess I have to build a rescue mission now!

Stock KSP doesnt currently have a grapple system outside of the docking ports. There is a mod called KAS, which adds winches and assorted grappling devices.
